content.description: Two blocks of equal mass are connected by a string that passes over a pulley, as shown in the figure. Block 1 hangs from the string, and block 2 can slide on a table. The system is released from rest. Using conservation of energy, a student derives an expression for the speed <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of block 1 when it has fallen a distance <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> after the system has been released from rest and obtains the equation <math alttext="v equals the square root of g h " overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>v</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>g</mi><mi>h</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: A third block of the same mass as blocks 1 and 2 is attached to block 2 on the table, as shown in the figure. Using conservation of energy, the student repeats a derivation for the speed <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of block 1 when it has fallen a distance <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
